text: Edmondson-Woodward House is a historic plantation house located near Stantonsburg, Wilson County, North Carolina. It was built about 1830, and is a two-story, three bay, single pile, "L"-plan, Federal style frame dwelling. It has a two-story wing added in the mid-19th century, side gable roof, exterior end chimneys, and hipped-roof porch with flared columns. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1986. ==References== Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1830 Category:Houses in Wilson County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wilson County, North Carolina
title: Edmondson-Woodward House
